item.title: Pavement eroded, kerb edge protrudes 1 - 2 inches, 31st July
item.description:
The pavement outside 59 Rosehill Street is eroded and has loose surface, the kerb now protrudes 1 - 2 inches for around 3m+ length. The erosion has occured over many years but as the surface appears to be loose seems to be eroding more quickly. The protruding kerb is now a tripping hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Rosehill Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: The traffic lights are not functioning correctly and are causing massive queues in all directions, 31st July
item.description:
Been reported before but you seem to ignore it , considering that it is the school holidays and therefore less works traffic these lights are making it impossible to get out of Wymans Brook
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A1, Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New cycle path installed not flooded before. Now water all over the road to Hare & Hounds PH. It would appear work done constructing the cycle path is either inadequate or damaged the existing infrastructure. Water was coming out of drains., 31st July
item.description:
Generally flood water on the road between Dowty’s and Hare & Hounds PH. Some drains causing water to rise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheely bin left outside for a year, 31st July
item.description:
A wheely bin has been left outside 6 Portland Square. It was reported to the council 15 months ago and already has an “environmental crime” sticker on it. It causes an obstruction on the narrow pavement and is a health hazard as it has been used for food waste and now has flies around it,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Portland Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signals heads have rotated., 31st July
item.description:
Whilst waiting at the stop line on the A40 at Arle Court roundabout toward Cheltenham both the lights for A40 and those for travelling around the roundabout are visible. It looks like both signal heads have rotated out of position slightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Court Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Path erosion, 31st July
item.description:
Location shown in photo attached. It's along the path across the fields joining the 2 flood defences / reservoirs from Prestbury towards Slad Way and on towards Battledown. It's at the specific point of the bridge over the stream, there's a lot of path erosion where dogs run out. There's so much now that roots are exposed and there are trip hazards near deepish water where it pools. The path is becoming narrower and the sooner it is bolstered the less the cost will be to repair it, which will eventually have to happen. It's inevitable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bouncers Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Abandoned Roadworks on Pavement, 31st July
item.description:
Gloucester Road (B4633) - on pavement by St Marks Methodist Chapel. You have closed my previous report (7511420) stating that my enquiry has been 'addressed'. This is disingenuous by GCC Highways. Three months after having reported this issue (via Fix My Street) I had to involve my GCC Councillor to find out why this obstruction continued to be in place. My councillor (not GCC Highways) informed me that the obstruction is due to Virgin Media (VM) infrastructure causing a trip hazard and GCC Highway's inability to get VM to fix their infrastructure. I will not consider this report to be 'addressed' until VM have fixed their infrastructure and this obstruction removed. Please DO NOT close this report until this is the case.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-8, Stow Court, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Abandoned large cone, 31st July
item.description:
A40 Lansdown Road - outside Laxton House (GL51 6PU). Large cone, sat in water-logged hole at vehicular access off A40 carriageway. Been there weeks - left over (abandoned) from works further along pavement weeks ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
